intro: Hieracium pseudostenstroemii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
